tn.text: They had conquered the people who lived in the land before they set up the tent of meeting. AT: "after they had conquered the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_events]])

tn.ref: whose inheritance had not been assigned
tn.text: The land that the tribes would receive is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they would receive as a permanent possession. This can be stated in active form. AT: "to whom Joshua had not assigned land as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: How long will you put off ... has given you?
tn.text: Joshua asks this question in order to encourage the Israelites to take possession of the land. AT: "For long enough, you have put off ... has given you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The words "up and down" mean in every direction. AT: "the land in every direction" or "throughout the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: write out a description of it with a view to their inheritances
tn.text: This means that they will describe the portions of land that each tribe would like to receive for an inheritance.
The land that they are to survey is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that each of the tribes would receive as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Joshua is continuing his speech to the children of Israel.
"They will divide the land"
"The tribe of Judah will remain"

Here the word "house" represents the descendants of Joseph. The phrase refers to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh. AT: "the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Joshua is continuing his speech to the children of Israel.
"no portion of land"

tn.ref: for the priesthood of Yahweh is their inheritance
tn.text: Joshua speaks of the great honor that the Levites have by serving Yahweh as priests as if it were something that they inherited. AT: "for the priesthood of Yahweh is what they have" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"half of the tribe of Manasseh"

The land that the tribes received is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received as a permanent possession. AT: "have received land as their inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Joshua speaks to the twenty-one men who were to go look at the land.

tn.ref: up and down in the land
tn.text: The words "up and down" mean in every direction. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:18:03|18:4]]. AT: "in every direction in the land" or "throughout the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: to each was given his portion of the land
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to each tribe Joshua gave their portion in the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The assignment of land for the tribe of Benjamin was given to each of their clans
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Each of the clans of the tribe of Benjamin received an assignment of land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: between the descendants of Judah and the descendants of Joseph
tn.text: "between the land that belonged to the descendants of Judah and the land that belonged to the descendants of Joseph"
This refers to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These refer to the same thing.

tn.ref: Luz ... Ataroth Addar ... Beth Horon ... Kiriath Baal ... Kiriath Jearim
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Kiriath Jearim ... Ephron ... Nephtoah ... Ben Hinnom ... Rephaim ... Hinnom ... En Rogel
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: En Shemesh ... Geliloth ... Adummim ... Beth Arabah
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This was likely a large stone that someone set up as a landmark and named after the man, Bohan. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:15:05|15:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Land that is in the form of a slope or ridge is spoken of as if it were a shoulder. AT: "the slope of Beth Arabah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the north shoulder of Beth Hoglah
tn.text: Land that is in the form of a slope or ridge is spoken of as if it were a shoulder. AT: "the north slope of Beth Hoglah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Benjamin
tn.text: The land that the tribe of Benjamin received is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received as a permanent possession. AT: "This was the land that the tribe of Benjamin received as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: it was given to each of their clans
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Joshua gave it to each of their clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The writer lists the cities that were in the land that the tribe of Benjamin received as an inheritance. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"the villages around them"
The writer continues to list the cities that were in the land that the tribe of Benjamin received as an inheritance. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: This was the inheritance of Benjamin
tn.text: The land and cities that the tribe of Benjamin received are spoken of as if they were an inheritance that they received as a permanent possession. AT: "This was the land and the cities that the tribe of Benjamin received as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
